sentences.en: ...a large supermarket chain.
sentences.cn: …一家大型连锁超市。

sentences.en: a chain of restaurants
sentences.cn: 连锁餐厅

sentences.en: a length of heavy chain
sentences.cn: 一段沉重的链条

sentences.en: a rather complicated chain of reasoning
sentences.cn: 相当复杂的推理过程

sentences.en: a short length of chain
sentences.cn: 一截短链条

sentences.en: Another man constantly chain-smoked and seemed to have the shakes.
sentences.cn: 另一名男子一直一支接一支地抽烟，似乎身体有些发抖。

sentences.en: Clasp the chain like so.
sentences.cn: 像这样扣上链子。

sentences.en: Doctors with glazed eyes sat chain-smoking in front of a television set.
sentences.cn: 医生们目光呆滞地坐在电视机前一支接一支地抽着烟。

sentences.en: He was led away in chains.
sentences.cn: 他戴着镣铐被带走了。

sentences.en: I'll lock the doors and chain you up.
sentences.cn: 我会锁上门，把你铐起来。

sentences.en: It set off a chain reaction in the international money markets.
sentences.cn: 这一事件在国际金融市场上引起了连锁反应。

sentences.en: Round her neck was a cross on a silver chain.
sentences.cn: 她脖子上戴着一条银项链，上面挂着个十字架。

sentences.en: She had a gold chain around her neck.
sentences.cn: 她脖子上戴了条金项链。

sentences.en: She was nervous and edgy, still chain-smoking.
sentences.cn: 她紧张不安，还在一根接一根地抽着烟。

sentences.en: She wore a fine chain about her alabaster neck.
sentences.cn: 她细腻光滑、美丽白皙的脖子上戴着一条精致的链子。

sentences.en: Students tried to form a human chain around the parliament.
sentences.cn: 学生们试图在议会四周围成人墙。

sentences.en: the chain of events that led to World War I
sentences.cn: 引发第一次世界大战的一连串事件

sentences.en: The dogs continued to paw and claw frantically at the chain mesh.
sentences.cn: 那些狗继续用爪子疯狂地抓铁丝网。

sentences.en: The house price chain is gummed up.
sentences.cn: 房屋买卖价格链已经失控。

sentences.en: The islands lie at the southern end of the Kurile chain.
sentences.cn: 这些岛屿位于千岛群岛的南端。

sentences.en: The lead biker broke his bike chain.
sentences.cn: 那位领先的自行车手车链子断了。

sentences.en: the Mayor’s chain of office
sentences.cn: 市长的链徽

sentences.en: The salesmen are just one link in the chain (= part of a process ) of distribution.
sentences.cn: 销售员只是整个经销过程中的一个环节。

sentences.en: Whenever recession strikes, a chain reaction is set into motion.
sentences.cn: 只要经济不景气，连锁反应就开始了。

words.tran_cn: 束缚（chain的过去分词）；用链条系住

phrases.tran_cn: (美，非正式)戏弄，揶揄某人（尤指使其相信不实之事）

trans.tran_cn: 链条，手铐，约束，一连串，连锁店
trans.tran_en: a series of metal rings which are joined together in a line and used for fastening things, supporting weights, decoration etc
to fasten someone or something to something else using a chain, especially in order to prevent them from escaping or being stolen
to fasten someone or something to something else using a chain, especially in order to prevent them from escaping or being stolen
